answers.answer: Welcome to the forum.80% of MS cases are of the Relapsing-Remitting type,  so I would say yes.    Have you been back to the Neurologist?Bob

question: I am a 39yrs old female with diabetes but 6yrs ago a neurologis told me that I may have MS after several tests.Back then I  only had vertigo and my rigth side a bit weak.2 months ahgo a had a nother episode of vertigo and loss of balance,muscle spasms,numbness and problems moving arms or legsproblems walking,problems with coordination and making small movementsTremor in arms or legsWeakness in right side of my body(arm or leg)also double vision and eye discomfortthat i did not have beforeI also have constipation and stool leakage,burning feeling in my spinal cord,decreased attention span, poor judgment, and memory loss,trouble swallowingand chokingMy question is can I have a relapsing episode of MS?
title: Maybe I have MS
